Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 14th overall pick, by New Jersey in 1964...
Had first career hit on 4/18/1966, off George Venegas (PG)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/9/1967, off Leonard Raymond (TOL)...
Signed as a free agent by Gashouse on 2/14/1971 to a 5-year deal worth $5,150,000 per year...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/23/1973, hitting .500 with 2 HR, 8 RBI...
Won World Championship with Gashouse in 1973...
Won World Championship with Gashouse in 1976...
Traded from Gashouse to Capital City on 2/12/1977 (Going to GHG: 1B C. Rael. Going to CC: RF D. Maser, P L. Esqueda, P R. Dealba)...
Signed as a free agent by Plum Grove on 4/21/1980 to a 1-year deal worth $592,000 per year...
Injured on 9/18/1981 with a Torn Abdominal Muscle, out for 5-6 weeks...
Traded from Plum Grove to Bay City on 2/2/1982 (Going to BC: RF D. Maser, C F. Curnutt. Going to PG: SS J. Patt)...
Won World Championship with Bay City in 1982...
Signed as a free agent by New Jersey on 2/14/1984 to a 1-year deal worth $1,808,000 per year...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/4/1984, hitting .375 with 4 HR, 7 RBI...
Drove in 6 runs against Plum Grove on 6/19/1985...
Batting Leader Boards Appearances
Doubles
1984 - 43 - 5th
